alarmRecommendedActions.recommendedActionId: Make sure the load equipment is operational and plugged in securely.

Check the sensor location for heat-generating equipment that has failed, been removed, or powered off accidentally. Make sure the threshold is set correctly, and the central air conditioning system is functioning properly.

Check the sensor location for heat-generating equipment that has failed, been removed, or powered off accidentally. Make sure the threshold is set correctly, and the central air conditioning system is functioning properly.

Check the sensor location to make sure no excess heat-generating equipment has been added and that proper airflow exists at that location. Make sure the threshold is set correctly, and the central air conditioning system is functioning properly.

Check the sensor location to make sure no excess heat-generating equipment has been added and that proper airflow exists at that location. Make sure the threshold is set correctly, and the central air conditioning system is functioning properly.

Check the sensor location for humidity-generating equipment that has failed, been removed, or powered off accidentally. Make sure the threshold is set correctly, and the central air conditioning system is functioning properly.

Check the sensor location for humidity-generating equipment that has failed, been removed, or powered off accidentally. Make sure the threshold is set correctly, and the central air conditioning system is functioning properly.

Check the sensor location to make sure no excess humidity-generating equipment has been added. Make sure the threshold is set correctly, and the central air conditioning system is functioning properly.

Check the sensor location to make sure no excess humidity-generating equipment has been added. Make sure the threshold is set correctly, and the central air conditioning system is functioning properly.
Ensure the input contact's normal state is defined properly in the "Environment" tab's "Dry Contact Inputs" section, then identify and correct any problem being monitored by that input.
